wikipedia_page.main:
Edward Garnett (born  (1965-06-02) 2 June 1965) was an English cricketer. He was a left-handed batsman and right-arm medium-fast bowler who played for Cheshire. He was born in Lancaster.
Garnett, who represented Cheshire in the Minor Counties Championship between 1993 and 2000, made a single List A appearance for the team, in the 1996 NatWest Trophy, against Cheshire. From the lower order, he scored 0 not out.

response: Edward Garnett was born in London. His father, Richard Garnett (1835–1906), was a writer and librarian at the British Museum. On 31 August 1889 Edward married Constance Black, known for her translations of Russian literature; the writer David Garnett (1892–1981) was their son.
*Edward Thomas: A selection of letters to Edward Garnett (1981 reprint)
*Edward Garnett: A Life in Literature (1982) George Jefferson
*An Uncommon Reader: A Life of Edward Garnett, Mentor and Editor of Literary Genius (2017) Helen Smith
* Edward Garnett (1868–1937), British writer, critic and editor
